result.execSummary:
The defendant David Kenneth Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Kenneth Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Kenneth Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
No violent or abusive contact with A.M.L
No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. Prescription medication to be taken as prescribed by medical provider.

Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.

Order for Payment of Attorney Fees

regarding order for payment filed by Atty Philip Helgeson. eif

3:04 PM Defendant David Kenneth Johnson in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for David Kenneth Johnson.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin.  22CM23 and 22CM103 heard at this time. ADA Schieffer: guilty to Ct#2 in 22CM23 1 year probation w/Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service, no violent or abusive contact with AML, court costs($543).. Dismiss Ct#1 in 22CM23 and 22CM103. Atty Helgeson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#2. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 22CM23, dismiss Ct#1 in 22CM23 and 22CM103.  ADA Schieffer and Atty Helgeson address sentencing. Court orders S/W 1 year probation on 22CM23- court costs ($543), No violent or abusive contact with A.M.L, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. Prescription medication to be taken as prescribed by medical provider. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 3:22
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:20 PM Defendant David Kenneth Johnson appears in Court, Atty Philip A. Helgeson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM23 and 22CM103. Atty Helgeson is requesting a plea date, ADA Schieffer is in agreement. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:24 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:33 AM Defendant David Kenneth Johnson appears in Court, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CM103 (IA) and 22CM23 (STC).  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $1,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NAC w/A.M.L. &  AS, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:36 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
